main event: Unidentified flying object observed in the sky over Heidelberg, Germany on November 8, 1965.
interesting points: The object was observed flying east then north-west, leaving a smoke trail approximately 10 feet long.
The object was first observed at an altitude of 26,000 feet and 3,520 feet, and was in sight for around 20 seconds.
The object had a flash of light that lasted for approximately 15 seconds, and the observers could not determine the definite speed, but it was faster than a jet aircraft.
The object appeared to be on a high ballistic trajectory and did not seem to be gliding.
The observers could not determine if the object crossed the border as it was too far away.
witnesses: Captain Legau and another unidentified observer
